intro: Verbesina mexiae, commonly known as Mexican beggarticks, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and dry fields. Verbesina mexiae is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
